name: eulogistically
content:

in a way that is like a eulogy (= a speech, piece of writing, poem, etc. containing great praise, especially for someone who has recently died): In its editorial, the paper writes eulogistically about the former Prime Minister. He is depicted sympathetically but not eulogistically in this biography. Related words

More examplesFewer examplesHe spoke eulogistically about the professor's academic work.She spoke eulogistically of the work of the organization and of the value of what it had achieved.He was eulogistically praised as a hard-working and efficient businessman.The leading newspapers wrote eulogistically about her work.He speaks kindly of his friend, though not eulogistically.
